required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Bioequivalence Between Nicotine Replacement Products and Nicorette® Gum
clinical_study.official_title: Bioequivalence Between Oral Nicotine Replacement Products and Nicorette® Gum - A Study in Healthy Smokers
clinical_study.source: Johnson & Johnson Consumer and Personal Products Worldwide

brief_summary.textblock: Bioequivalence between oral nicotine replacement products and Nicorette® gum.

detailed_description.textblock: This study compares a new oral Nicotine Replacement Therapy (NRT) product containing 2 and 4 mg nicotine with Nicorette® gum 2 mg and 4 mg, after 12 hours of nicotine abstinence, with respect to nicotine pharmacokinetics, during 10 hours after start of administration. Single doses of each treatment are given once in the morning during four separate treatment visits scheduled in a crossover setting with randomized treatment sequences. The study will include 88 healthy smokers between 18-50 years, who have been smoking at least 10 cigarettes daily during at least one year preceding inclusion. Subjects and study personnel will be aware of which treatment is administered at a given visit.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and during 10 hours after product administration
primary_outcome.description: Pharmacokinetic measurements including: the maximum observed nicotine concentration in plasma (Cmax) the area under the plasma concentration-vs.-time curve until the last measurable concentration (AUCt) the area under the plasma concentration-vs.-time curve until infinity (AUCinf)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: during 10 hours after start of product administration
secondary_outcome.description: The time of occurrence of Cmax (tmax) following product administration

secondary_outcome.time_frame: during 10 hours after start of product administration
secondary_outcome.description: The terminal nicotine elimination rate constant (λz)
The amount of nicotine released from Nicorette® gum 2 and 4 mg during 30 minutes' chewing.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From product administration until completely dissolved
secondary_outcome.description: Actual time required for oral dissolution of new NRT products following product administration

arm_group.description: 2 mg single-dose of a new NRT product
2 mg single-dose of a marketed nicotine gum
4 mg single-dose of a new NRT product
4 mg single-dose of marketed nicotine gum

intervention.description: Single-dose of a new Nicotine Replacement Therapy (NRT) product 2 mg and 4 mg
Single-dose of marketed nicotine gum 2 mg or 4 mg

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy smokers, smoking at least 10 cigarettes daily during at least one year preceding inclusion and BMI between 17.5 and 30.0 kg/m2.
- Female participants of child-bearing potential are required to use a medically acceptable means of birth control.
- A personally signed and dated informed consent document, indicating that the subject has been informed of all pertinent aspects of the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy, lactation or intended pregnancy.
- Treatment with an investigational product or donation or loss of blood within 3 month preceding the first dose of study medication.
